intro: Nigellastrum, commonly known as black cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its small, dark blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are rich in essential oils and have been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features include hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. Nigellastrum is often cultivated for its aromatic seeds and medicinal properties.
